comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: AMERICA WINS TWO DAVIS CUP MATCHES; McLoughlin Defeats Rice and Williams Wins from Doust in Tennis Tourney. June 7, 1913, Saturday Page 9, 1591 words America triumphed over Australia in the first session of the preliminary round of the Davis Cup competition yesterday on the grass court of the West Side Tennis Club, 238th Street and Broadway. Two matches in singles were played, and after the last ace had been disposed of America came out in the lead by winning both. [ query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9F01E5D71F3AE633A... Maurice E. McLoughlin (American) defeated Horace M. Rice (Australia) R. Norris Williams (American, Philadelphia) Stanley M. Doust (Australia) Looks to be the quarter finals of Davis Cup play for 1913: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1913_International_Lawn_Tennis_Chal... Williams and McLoughlin would go on to win the tournament. Wikipedia on McLoughlin: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maurice_McLoughlin

comment._content: Harry Angstrom: Thanks for the detailed information! We can now add a lot more information to the records for the several images of McLoughlin and Rice playing each other when we update.
